meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of Marvel's Spider-Man 2:

In a world where superhero games are as common as your average hipster's Instagram post, it takes a lot to stand out from the crowd. But Insomniac Games has done just that with their latest masterpiece - Marvel's Spider-Man 2. And trust me, it's not just your average, everyday Spidey game (although, let's be real, there's nothing wrong with those either).

As I dove into the world of Manhattan and beyond, I was struck by how seamlessly the gameplay flowed. It's like they took all the best bits from previous Spider-Man games, threw in some new tricks, and voil√†! You get a game that feels like it was meant to be played. And don't even get me started on the story - Peter Parker and Miles Morales' adventures are woven together with such care, you can't help but feel invested in their journeys.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about all those other critics who gave it perfect scores?" Well, let me tell you, I'm not saying they're wrong (I mean, who doesn't love a good superhero game?). But sometimes, when everyone's singing the same song, I like to throw in some variety (pun intended). Variety, Game Informer, Slant Magazine - they all loved it for good reason. And I won't lie, I did too.

But what really sets Spider-Man 2 apart is its willingness to take risks. Miles Morales, as a character, brings a fresh energy to the franchise, and Insomniac makes sure he's given the spotlight (and rightfully so). The game's got heart, humor, and even some genuine emotional depth. It's not just your typical superhero fare; it's an actual story with characters you care about.

In conclusion, if you're a fan of Spider-Man (and who isn't?), you owe it to yourself to play Marvel's Spider-Man 2. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. And if you are, well, I'll just be over here, playing the game and enjoying every minute of it. Hippo Penny out!
